db:abstract.db:para: Reduces the saturation of the colors.
This type was introduced in QtGraphicalEffects 1.0.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Desaturated pixel values are calculated as averages of the original RGB component values of the source item.

db:section.db:title: Example
db:section.db:para: The following example shows how to apply the effect.

db:section.db:title: cached : bool
db:section.db:para: This property allows the effect output pixels to be cached in order to improve the rendering performance.

Every time the source or effect properties are changed, the pixels in the cache must be updated. Memory consumption is increased, because an extra buffer of memory is required for storing the effect output.
It is recommended to disable the cache when the source or the effect properties are animated.
By default, the property is set to false.

db:section.db:title: desaturation : real
db:section.db:para: This property defines how much the source colors are desaturated.
The value ranges from 0.0 (no change) to 1.0 (desaturated). By default, the property is set to 0.0 (no change).

db:th.db:para: Output examples with different desaturation values

db:section.db:title: source : variant
db:section.db:para: This property defines the source item that provides the source pixels to the effect.

db:note.db:para: It is not supported to let the effect include itself, for instance by setting source to the effect's parent.
